ygData.subject: Re: RE: if you dont feel like hearing a rant don
ygData.msgSnippet: The person who brought up the Jig thing is obviously new to the list and thought that (s)he had some juicy info for us.  It happens. There is a lot of bad info
ygData.messageBody:
The person who brought up the Jig thing is obviously new to the list
and thought that (s)he had some juicy info for us. It happens. There
is a lot of bad info out there on the net. No need to blast the poor
person. As per the twinking thread, it is a very emotional issue and
people need to vent their frustration. It's a very human need. I
found it a bit boring after awhile but it is not that hard to hit the
delete button, even 30 time. And it is a lot more interesting then
reading some work related e-mail. :)

Bujold 18th
Xegony


______________________________ Reply Separator _________________________________
Subject: [eqbards] RE: if you dont feel like hearing a rant dont re
Author: Non-HP-tcyr (tcyr@...) at HP-ColSprings,mimegw5
Date: 7/22/99 10:17 AM


From: "CYR, Thierry" <tcyr@...>

Is it me or do the same stupid subjects come back every week? Such as Jig,
people please lay this subject to rest, its been overdone, it doesnt do
squat to help the party regen rate.... And whats with the off topic stuff?
why is it that a subject will get started on a quest or an item, and next
thing you know, you get 30 more emails with the same subject but its about
favorite weapons or twinking? come on guys, give it up. stick to quests and
stuff like that please. Some topics are great, like the rubicite threads,
the dream weapons and such, but they always take a left turn and end up
being a huge spam of the ol inbox about twinking and irrelevant stuff. I get
in the morning and read about 7 or 8 emails, and delete well over 40 emails,
thats not including the ones i delete during the day.

Minkin Nehoc
Bard of the 27th chorus
Solusek Ro



> -----Original Message-----
> From: RON_TALBOT@...
> [SMTP:RON_TALBOT@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 22, 1999 1:06 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Jaxan's Jig (not)
>
> From: RON_TALBOT@...
>
> Ummm... This has been thoroughly researched by many of us on this
> list. It seems to effect how often the bar is refreshed but does not
>
> actually improve the speed of mana regeneration. We have conducted
> many tests with stopwatches and such. In fact we have beat the
> subject to death.. (he he) It doesn't help at all. Period. We
> WISH
> it did, in fact it would be a great way to cure the level 15 to 32 no
>
> one wants to party with Bards blues but, sigh, it is not to be. Trust
>
> us, that web site is wrong.
>
> Bujold 18th
> Xegony
>
>
> ----------------------------------------------------------------------
> I have a computer, a remote control, and pizza delivery. Why should I
>
> leave the house?
>
>
> ______________________________ Reply Separator
> _________________________________
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Jaxan's Jig
> Author: Non-HP-kirsten (kirsten@...) at HP-ColSprings,mimegw5
> Date: 7/22/99 7:52 AM
>
>
> From: Kirsten Jones <kirsten@...>
>
> Greetings all,
>
> I've noticed that nobody seems to know how Jaxan's Jig can be helpful...
> one
> of the websites mentioned that it increases the recovery pulse rate for
> all
> three bars (not just stamina) from approximately 8sec/pulse to 6
> sec/pulse.
> So what? Well, what this means is:
>
> - If you are in a party with casters, they get a 20-25% increase on mana
> regen
> (this has been independently verified with a cleric)
> - If you are in a party with other bards, your healing songs should
> increase at the
> same rate (haven't tested this one)
>
> Just the first one alone, along with psalm and selo's, make you an even
> more critical member of a party. Some bards, when presented with this
> information, say "but that makes my mana regen song useless," and so won't
>
> even try it. Of course, the mana regen song is, what, 50%? So it's still
>
> an upgrade. But bards who don't take advantage of this "side effect" of
> Jaxan's are, in my opinion, slighting themselves and their party.
>
> Anyhow, just thought I'd share :-)
>
> Synedra of Veshaan
>
